item.title: More Shells
item.description:
Well I’ve been pretty busy recently, as the semester winds down the workload typically ramps up… So it goes.

I’ve been trying to find the time to write here more, and sometimes I have. It’s just that so many of my words end up being for me and me alone, and because of that this place continues to look empty…

Well, to help fight the emptiness, here are some shell renders I did. I was asked to enter these in an image competition, but first I’m releasing them here under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

If you haven’t seen my other post about shells then visit it, I talk a little bit about how they’re generated and link to the paper this is based off of.

Turritella

Boat Ear Moon

Ancilla

Argonauta

Precious Wentletrap

item.title: Resume as of November 2018
Mathematical Seashells
item.description:
In Seashells: The Plainness and Beauty of their Mathematical Description, Jorge Picado describes the mathematics necessary to simulate the shape of a multitude of different seashells. In this post, I wanted to share some renders I created while implementing Picado’s math into SciView and how the fourteen parameters function.

Defining the Spiral

The parameters D, A, alpha and beta allow us to construct any variety of spiral we want.

D specifies the chirality of the seashell - which direction it spirals.


A determines how far the beginning of the spiral is from the center of rotation, although it also manifests itself into determining how the diameter changes in size. It’s hard to see, but here is the same shell as above, with a smaller A value.

alpha is thankfully (a little) more straightforward. This value is the angle between a line drawn from the center of the spiral to any point on the surface, and the tangent at the point on the surface. In other words, it specifies the rate of spiraling.




This means that an angle of 90 degrees should create a circle (or a torus for this example)

beta is even more simple than alpha. beta is the angle between the axis of rotation and the edge of the generating spiral. Here is the same spiral, but with varrying values of beta.



Making Shells

The above spirals, while still shells, are very thin on purpose. However, while they show the underlying spiral simply, they can’t represent most seashells on their own. To do this, we must introduce an ellipse that will fill the space. This generating curve can be any shape, but for now it remains an ellipse.

Defining the ellipse is done with two new variables a and b - the radii of the ellipse.

Now that’s a seashell! What happens when a and b change though?


Yea the last one looks messed up, but the first one looks like it could pass as a real shell!

Bonus Shell

At this point I surrender myself to the hour, and finish this post for now. In the meantime, here’s something cool to look at.

item.title: Old Snow
item.description:
It’s cold today
But that’s okay
Because even though the leaves and I are falling
This autumn weather is still soft and charming
As time moves forward it does less and less harming
And things move towards harmony

I remember the old days
Those November/December cold days
When we’d walk and shiver in the winter haze
Before we ever used a word like bae

The nostalgia came and hit me hard
Gave me the energy to write these bars
And the memories of junk food dates in my car
It’s heartbreaking that we’ve become so far

There are still traces of you wherever I go
Emotions captured by falling leaves and snow
But now that we can open up to talk
I can finally let the grieving go
As long you are doing okay, and that I know

item.title: Pawn
item.description:
Now that I am free of that world
I am alone in a new one
Everything is a copy of what it once was
And I am merely a pawn
But a pawn with confidence
Is a pawn that understands death
Not as a tragedy, but as a choice
The power to make one sacrifice
So everyone else can do their best

item.title: Repeat
item.description:
Don’t drink so much coffee
Before you try and sleep
You’re mind will race with thoughts
Stuck on repeat
Stuck on repeat
Stuck on repeat
And you won’t be scared
But you’ll jerk awake
Making an audible gasp for air
Stuck on repeat
On repeat
On repeat
Thoughts race faster
Like a river during downpour
Yet they go nowhere
Stuck
This is is why you
Repeat

item.title: Destined
item.description:
sunsets seen
though never captured
a time capsule in a ghost town
a snowflake that never meets the snow
holding your breath
when your house is a vacuum
all that was meant
but could not make it
and not because it couldn’t have tried

item.title: Gold Tinted Glass
item.description: Through the gold tinted glass, the man nodded his head, so I did too

item.title: Beautiful
item.description:
I want to make something beautiful
I want to be something beautiful

But there’s nothing inside me
No hint towards creativity
No passion
No pain
No hope to change
Just damned up tears
All of my magnified fears

Can these words really express me?
Break apart the walls in my head
And relieve me of this anxiety?
So terrified of society

I’ll just put the walls back up

item.title: The Next Me
item.description:
I’m terrified of the next me
And what he will do
In the ways that he does nothing

item.title: Change
item.description:
Two pills
Pop them
Crawl in
Warm bed
Empty head
Dreams of dread?
They’re all dead

But I’m not

Done growing
I keep showing
Myself I can change
Thoughts rearrange
Sometimes derange
Derail, a torn sail
Cannot bail
From this ship
I’m the captain
And the arsonist
Who started this
Fantastic mess
You thought I would accomplish less?
That low bar is a personal best
That I keep setting
Lower
And lower
Thought I’d be the limbo king by now
But all I wear are khakis and a plastic crown
Fishhooks in my cheeks to prevent a frown
From showing
Not done growing
I still change
I can’t be the same
As my old self
And my health
Neither rises
Or lowers
These lures
Keep catching me
Still got the hooks as you can see
Getting pulled in every which way direction
Cant form a proper sentence
Or ask a simple question
Most of the time
Yet I can still bust rhyme
It’s my way to pass the time
And I seem to do it fairly fine
Which is nice cuz it don’t cost me a dime
But it cost me my life
Working on things I think are important
Create code to capture meaning then store it
Stashed away from any who’d whore it
Out, to those who would misuse it
Rip the meaning right out of it’s socket
Like isolated islands bought by cruise ships
Old songs being turned into shitty pop hits
Knockoff brands for the poor misfits
Misinformation for the dumb and half wits

item.title: Asleep
item.description:
“It’s easy to write your thoughts down that way” So said the speaker - a very extroverted creature, a conversational exhibitionist with cosmic quandaries boiled down to aether, we spoke but mostly he talked - I said nothing, I wouldn’t want my spirits eradicated either. To live in the mind is to live blind - my eyes tied at the lid, tied to the skies were my mysteries hid, how easily could they shatter if I left procrastination for another matter.

I was him and he was me. We had different worlds but felt it wholly. A better form than holy, as wholly connects us by how not what we feel. We both felt that fascination, we both felt our levels of expertise over our past selves. We had learned so so much, in one form or another, and had little time already spent.

item.title: In Stone
item.description:
I always find myself here. Laying in bed, waiting for the day to roll over as I do. Twisting and turning, I can never find the right position to begin falling asleep. Though my eyes can barely lift their lids, my head isn’t ready to call it quits - for today that is.

I always find myself here. Fingers on keys, eyes on the screen, though it keeps burning. I write my stream of thoughts into ones and zeros, kept understandable by the unicode standard (at least a little).

I always find myself here. At the junction of passing thoughts. One to describe reality as the motion and interactions of energy, nothing more. And another, that has already passed me by. I guess it’s only nothingness now.

I always find myself here. Wanting to be one person: cohesive, homogeneous, singular and unchanging. Wanting to be capable of finishing my plans, wanting to know who I am. Occasionally I stumble upon my old skin, where I used to live. Sometimes it still fits, though I always tear it. I can’t go back to the old me. Last week was a lifetime ago, tomorrow is in a couple of minutes.

I always find myself here. Trying to write my words into stone, so that I can reflect and grow. My words are carved slow, as does rebuilding my hope. Hope - just as my words, exists only as wind.

Until I capture it in stone.

item.title: What to Expect Here
item.description:
In all honesty, few processes of my head are consistent. That being said…

  • I do write poetry more often than other things, so expect more of that.
  • By having a blog readily available, I might actually contribute…
  • There’s a lot of Computer Science topics that I want to share.

If you’ve read my About page then you know that I don’t like reinventing wheels. But did you know that I’m also on Medium? ;)

Again, consistency is not a Conrad thing unless I document everything about what I was thinking at the time. So I’ll probably be posting personal projects here too in case I ever want to go back to something.
